alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 10 at 12:07AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...From later Friday through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavier rain over the Olympics Friday evening through Saturday will produce 2 to as much as 3.5 inches of rain with snow levels around 5,000 feet. This rainfall could drive the Skokomish River to near or above flood stage Saturday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
